title: Trump guilty in New York trial, becoming the first former US president to be a convicted felon
summary: 'I am a very innocent man,' said Trump after 12 jurors found him unanimously guilty, on Thursday, on all 34 counts for falsifying business records in a scheme to influence the 2016 election. The conviction doesn't bar him from running for president.

title: American and British air strikes hit several sites in Yemen
summary: The British defense ministry said it was an operation 'against Houthi military facilities to degrade their ability to persist with their attacks on international shipping in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.'

title: Paris disinvites Russia to D-Day celebrations
summary: In April, organizers said that Russia – but not President Vladimir Putin – would be invited to Normandy. But on Thursday, the French presidency said 'the conditions are not right.'

title: Israel: Benny Gantz's party submits bill to hold early election
summary: The centrist war cabinet minister requested 'to move forward in broad agreement to an election,' his party said.

title: Biden partially lifts ban on Ukraine using US missiles on Russian territory to defend Kharkiv
summary: The US officials, who requested anonymity to discuss the sensitive matter, underscored that the US policy calling on Ukraine not to use American munitions to strike inside Russia offensively has not changed.

title: Thousands of Polish emigrants return home after living in Western Europe
summary: Hundreds of thousands of Poles left their homeland for Western Europe following Poland's accession to the EU in 2004. Today, the country's economic development is prompting many to return home.

title: China shows its support for Arab states, in opposition to US support for Israel
summary: Believing that the image of the US is deteriorating in the Middle East, Xi Jinping took advantage of the China-Arab Cooperation Summit in Beijing to push for a 'more broad-based, authoritative and effective international peace conference' on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: James Webb telescope finds record-breaking distant galaxy
summary: For the second time since it came online in 2022, images from the groundbreaking James Webb Space Telescope have allowed a team of scientists to discover the new record-holder of the most distant known galaxy, dubbed JADES-GS-z14-0.

title: In Sweden, parents of young children question the omnipresence of screens
summary: As part of a series exploring parenting abroad, this week Le Monde looks at Sweden where 82% of 9-year-olds have a cell phone, yet no official guidelines on screen time exist.

title: Slovenian parliament set to vote on recognizing Palestinian state
summary: Following a decree from Slovenia's center-left government submitting the recognition of a Palestinian state to a parliamentary vote, in an effort to end the conflict in Gaza, the parliament speaker announced that the vote would take place on Tuesday, June 4.

title: New Caledonia: Will EU elections be held as planned in French Pacific territory?
summary: The overseas territory has just emerged from a state of emergency after weeks of riots and unrest. Prime Minister Gabriel Attal tells Le Monde the government will do 'everything necessary to ensure that the elections take place' on June 9, like in the rest of France.

title: French actress Isild Le Besco sues director Benoît Jacquot, accusing him of rape
summary: Le Besco filed a legal complaint accusing Jacquot of rapes between 1998 and 2007, joining fellow actor Judith Godrèche, who has also accused him of raping her when she was a teenager.

title: New Caledonia: the Pacific franc – a colonial legacy turned identity issue
summary: The archipelago retains its currency, shared with Polynesia and Wallis and Futuna. While the business community would like the greater fluidity of joining the euro, the island's independence movement is fiercely opposed.

title: French Open bans alcohol in the stands in crackdown on unruly fans
summary: David Goffin claimed he was spat at by a spectator while women's defending champion Iga Swiatek scolded spectators for making noise during her match with Naomi Osaka.

title: Five clients sentenced to prison for sexual exploitation of a 12-year-old girl
summary: Six men were on trial near Paris for buying the sexual services of a very young teenage girl in hotel rooms.

title: Football: Monaco player gets four-match ban for hiding anti-homophobia logo
summary: Camara opted not to support a French league campaign against homophobia by hiding the logo on the front of his shirt as he played for Monaco against Nantes in the final game of the season on May 19.
